newsitem.title: USA: Washington Water chairman to retire.
newsitem.headline: Washington Water chairman to retire.

text.p: Washington Water Power said Friday its Chairman and Chief Executive Paul Redmond plans to retire.
The company said in a statement that it has retained an executive search firm to seek out a replacement, the search os expected to take at least six to nine months.
"The company is financially healthy and well positioned for success in the future," Redmond said.
"This is the perfect time for the right person to lead our company to new heights of performance and success."
Redmond joined Washington Water Power in 1965 and was appointed president and chief operating officer in 1982 and then chairman and chief executive in 1985.
The exact timing of Redmond's retirement will be based on allowing for a smooth transition to the incoming chairman and chief executive.
